RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ESSENTIAL MAGIC accelerated to the lead nearing the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, kept the advantage at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled in the lane. KNOBIESMAGICSONDE had a brief early lead then pressured the winner nearing the three eighths pole, contested at a close disadvantage off the rail through the turn but dropped back into the lane and settled for second best. GHOST OF ALCINA gave distant early chase toward mid track, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. LUZIA gave chase toward the outside, rounded the turn about the six path and finished evenly to pass rivals. OPPO TACO chased toward mid track, raced in the five path of the turn and showed little in the lane. WORM gave chase outside and rounded the turn about the seven path. XTENDED STREAK came away awkwardly then angled in to give chase, raced near the rail on the turn and weakened into the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Essential Magic
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 3/8,set pressured pace,rail turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Knobiesmagicsonde
ENTRY.COMMENT: briefly led,pressed pace,close off rail turn,settled 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 65. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 10 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MARINA GRANDE veered out leaving the gate but closed to the lead while tapering in and rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. LOVE OF GRACE settled off the rail on the opening turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, improved two deep on the far turn and came along for second later yards. LAUGHINTOTHEBANK rated close in the three path on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn but dropped back leaving the turn and relented second in later yards. FRENCHIES GOLD saved ground off the pace, bid approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and ran evenly in the lane. LUCKY BOP rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, was eased to the four path on the far turn then flattened in the lane. SNEAKY LYNK rated close off the rail, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but faded into the far turn. LIVANA stalked from the two and three paths, challenged approaching the five sixteenths pole but dropped back into the far turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Sneaky Lynk
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,chased 7/16,faded into far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Laughintothebank
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close 3p 1st turn,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,relent 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Love of Grace
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 7/16,improved 2d far turn,along 2nd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Marina Grande
ENTRY.OWNER: Jay A Reese LLC and Hatter Edgar
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,up near 3/4,rated pace,rail turn,driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 12500. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MUD BUG rounded the first turn in the five path and rated close from the seven eighths pole, took the lead approaching the three eighths, drew clear toward the five sixteenths, was urged at the rail into the far turn and held well with steady stretch handling. NET WORTH settled off the rail, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, then dueled through the stretch for second. MY SLICK NICK rated close inside, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. GAMING SOUL saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly down the lane. ONLY GET'N BETTER saved ground well off the early pace, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, improved off the rail on the far turn but showed little further. ROBBEDINTHEBAHAMAS raced in the four path the first turn then stalked from the seven eighths pole, took the lead past the three quarter pole but was met toward the three eighths and faded from that point. SHAKIN IT BIG TIME rated close to the early pace in the two and three paths, gave chase into the backstretch but weakened into the far turn. MORE TAJ set the early pace inside but was met leaving the three quarter pole and faded on the second turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Gaming Soul
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Mud Bug
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 96. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 10 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Al lowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROCKET APPEAL raced with the pace three wide through the front stretch then stalked, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn but dug in leaving the turn and got up the final yards. ICING rated a slim lead inside, was met by Nichiren at the nine sixteenths pole, put that one away passing the five sixteenths and contested the advantage at the rail on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn but was caught in the final yards. CANDY INVASION raced well off the pace and off the rail on the opening turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path, dueled through the stretch and just lasted for third. LATE IN THE GAME raced well off the pace about the four path, left the first turn outside and bid nearing the three eighths pole, came through the far turn at the rail, finished well and just missed taking third. FREEDOM RIDER raced off the rail early, chased leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened in the lane. STEAL THE CASH saved ground, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and finished well outside. NICHIREN raced with the early pace two deep while between horses, challenged nearing the three eighths pole but dropped back past the five sixteenths and weakened on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Steal the Cash
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,5p far turn,finished well outside

ENTRY.NAME: Late in the Game
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 4p,outside 1/2,bid 3/8,rail far turn,just missd 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GEORGE hustled to the front nearing the seven sixteenths pole and rated the pace, rounded the turn at the rail, drew off through the upper stretch then coasted the final sixteenth. HARLEY SIOUX raced in tight on the chute then chased outside, rounded the turn about the six path, dug in leaving the turn and took the nod for second. SCARE DEM was bumped and steadied in the vicinity of the half mile pole, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, angled to the four path into the lane and just missed the nod for second. GAMBLING FEVER became anxious in the gate, broke in and made contact with All Roads To Denis, gave chase toward the inside, rounded the turn at the rail then flattened the final sixteenth. IT'S ONLY MONEY came away awkwardly and was pinched back on the chute, settled off the early pace outside, angled in with a bid at the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn about the four path and flattened the final sixteenth. SMALL PAW became anxious in the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path and flattened in the lane. ALL ROADS TO DENIS was bumped at the break and never factored. RAISE A RUCKUS engaged in close chase through the backstretch but weakened off the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: George
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to lead,rated pace,rail turn,drew off,coasted final 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Gambling Fever
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Harley Sioux
ENTRY.OWNER: Straughn William E and Thacker Daniel

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 77. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 10 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Consider ed In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHANGE THE WORLD rated close off the rail on the first turn, started a four wide bid approaching the seven sixteenths pole, contested at a close disadvantage in the three path on the far turn, dueled at even terms in the upper stretch and drew clear in later yards. COUSIN WINNIE stalked three wide, took the lead at the half mile pole and came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was met approaching the five sixteenths, raced close at the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and dug in to take second the final strides. HESSICA ducked in leaving the gate but showed the way through the front stretch, stalked into the first turn then picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, took the lead three wide nearing the five sixteenths, contested the edge off the rail on the far turn, dug in at even terms in the upper stretch but relented toward the sixteenth pole and was nipped from second the final strides. LADRO DI FICHI saved ground, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and flattened in the lane. BAYS CASTLE rounded the first turn about the six path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and flattened in the lane. BREADMAN'S ROSEBUD was forced out at the break and rounded the first turn about the seven path and showed little response through the backstretch. HAPPY RIDE veered out leaving the gate, raced in the five path the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. LADY CINCO DE MAYO took the lead at the rail into the first turn, was met into the backstretch and gave chase from that point, but faded past the five sixteenths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Change the World
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,4wd bid 7/16,close 3p far turn,dueled clear later yds

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Ride
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,5p 1st turn,chased 3/8,weakened far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 32700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LACE REVOLUTION saved ground well off the early pace, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, closed the gap at the rail on the far turn, came around COMPLETE SURPRISE leaving the eighth pole, took over from that one nearing mid-stretch and drew away the final sixteenth. The latter was hustled to the front and moved to the inside past the five eighths pole, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dug in from the head of the lane, but was met toward mid-stretch and relented the final sixteenth. MYGIDGETMARIE steadied at the rail into the first turn then stalked two deep, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn but flattened stride inside the eighth pole. DULCIMER DAME rounded the opening turn in the three and four paths, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the turn about the four path and flattened in the lane. SOMEDAY IS TODAY settled off the pace about the three path the first turn, gave chase past the half mile pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and showed little in the lane. BABA bobbled at the break and rounded the opening turn in the five path, gave chase past the half mile pole but showed little response. BABY MAN settled close in the three path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole but faded approaching the far turn. The Stewards reviewed then dismissed a claim of foul for alleged interference into the first turn, lodged by the rider of Mygidgetmarie, against the rider of Complete Surprise.

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Man
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb Michael and America's Pastime Stables

ENTRY.NAME: Lace Revolution
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 7/16,closed gap rail turn,up 1/16,drew off late

ENTRY.NAME: Someday Is Today
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p,chased 1/2,4p far turn,little in lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 14100. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE DECEMBER 10, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Ra ces Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOMMER VELVET took over nearing the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure at the rail midway on the far turn and opened up with only mild urging. CENTERFOLD ANGEL bobbled after the start and rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, flattened stride late and just lasted for second. SOCIAL EXCLUSION saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, dug in through the stretch and held on for third. EMMA AND I saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, finished well and just missed third. SHERIFF'S KID raced boxed at the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and flattened stride. MISS WILD tapered in and stalked two deep, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but flattened at the rail on the far turn. SO RED THE ROSE lunged from the gate, raced in the four path on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Centerfold Angel
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Shake and Bake Racing LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Sommer Velvet
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured rail mid turn,opened up,mild urging
